Here are 10 daily habits that the experts listed above may suggest for living a healthy and long life:

1. Exercise regularly - Regular physical activity has been shown to have numerous health benefits, including improving cardiovascular health, reducing the risk of chronic diseases, and improving mental health.
2. Eat a healthy diet - A diet rich in whole, unprocessed foods such as vegetables, fruits, nuts, and whole grains can help support overall health and well-being.
3. Get enough sleep - Adequate sleep is important for maintaining physical and mental health. Most adults need 7-9 hours of sleep per night.
4. Practice stress management techniques - Chronic stress can have negative effects on health, so finding ways to manage stress, such as through meditation or exercise, is important.
5. Stay hydrated - Drinking enough water is essential for maintaining proper bodily functions and overall health.
6. Don't smoke - Smoking is a major risk factor for a number of serious health problems, including lung cancer and heart disease.
7. Limit alcohol consumption - Excessive alcohol consumption can increase the risk of health problems such as liver disease and certain types of cancer.
8. Get vaccinated - Vaccines can help protect against serious and potentially life-threatening diseases.
9. Practice good hygiene - Washing your hands regularly and following proper hygiene practices can help prevent the spread of illness.
10. Stay engaged and mentally active - Engaging in activities that challenge the mind, such as reading, puzzles, or learning a new skill, can help keep the brain active and healthy.
